intro: Pelecynthis rhomboidea, commonly known as the rhomboid pelecynthis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive rhomboid-shaped fruits, which are a key feature in its botanical classification. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is native to certain regions of southern Africa. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and it produces small, white or pale yellow flowers. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
